author: Paul Vigna
title: Investors Bet $4 Billion on a Cryptocurrency Startup - WSJ
text:
A start-up company based in the Cayman Islands is on track to raise more than $4 billion through a yearlong sale of digital tokens—the largest fundraising of its kind.
What buyers of the tokens still don’t know: how the company, block.one, will use the bulk of the windfall from its so-called initial coin offering.
If the company ends up raising... RELATED VIDEO Bitcoin 101: What It Is, How to Invest The virtual currency bitcoin continues surging to new highs as a frenzy of investors get in on the action. WSJ's Paul Vigna explains what you need to know, and how to invest should you want to join the mania. Photo: Alexander Hotz/The Wall Street Journal.
